Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can show plants with water and plants without water in their drawing.
The student can illustrate how plants look different when they have enough water compared to when they do not.
The student can represent in their drawing that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can observe patterns by drawing plants that receive water and those that don't, noting differences.
The student can demonstrate the idea that all living things have needs, just like plants need water.
